translated: The Questions of King Milinda🔽The Description of the Formless States
The Question about the Cessation of Breathing
‘It is possible to stop breathing in and breathing out.’

original: “Āma, mahārāja, sakkā assāsapassāse nirodhetun”ti.🔽“Kathaṁ, bhante nāgasena, sakkā assāsapassāse nirodhetun”ti.
analyzed: āma mahā rāja sakkā assāsa passāse nirodhetunti  katha bhante nāgasena sakkā assāsa passāse nirodhetunti
translated: “Yes, sire, it is possible to stop breathing in and breathing out.”🔽“How is it possible, revered sir?”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, sutapubbo te koci kākacchamāno”ti.
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja suta pubbaḥ te koci kākacchamāno ti
translated: “What do you think about this, sire? Have you ever heard of anyone who imitated a crow?”
“Yes, revered sir, I have heard of it.”

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, mahārāja, so saddo kāye namite virameyyā”ti.
analyzed: kim nu kho mahā rāja saḥ saddo kāye namite virameyya ati
translated: “Now, sire, would that sound cease if the body were bent down?”

original: “So hi nāma, mahārāja, saddo abhāvitakāyassa abhāvitasīlassa abhāvitacittassa abhāvitapaññassa🔽kāye namite viramissati, kiṁ pana bhāvitakāyassa bhāvitasīlassa bhāvitacittassa bhāvitapaññassa
analyzed: saḥ hi nāma mahā rāja saddaḥ abhāvita kāyassa abhāvita sīlassa abhāvita cittassa abhāvita paññassa  kāye namite viramissati kim pana bhāvita kāyassa bhāvita sīlassa bhāvita cittassa bhāvita paññassa
translated: “That sound, sire, would cease if the body were bent down by one whose body was undeveloped, whose virtue was undeveloped, whose mind was undeveloped, whose wisdom was undeveloped,🔽so how could the in-breaths and out-breaths not cease in one whose body is developed, whose virtue is developed, whose mind is developed, whose wisdom is developed,

analyzed: catuttha jhānam samāpannassa assāsa passāsāḥ na nirujjhissanti iti
translated: and who has attained the fourth jhāna?”
The eleventh question on the cessation of in-breath and out-breath.
